trans-unit.source: When the log is in a non-default location

seg-source.mrk: When the log is in a non-default location

target.mrk: When the log is in a non-default location

trans-unit.source: If you put the database log in a non-default location prior to backing up the database, be aware of the following requirements.

seg-source.mrk: If you put the database log in a non-default location prior to backing up the database, be aware of the following requirements.

target.mrk: If you put the database log in a non-default location prior to backing up the database, be aware of the following requirements.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an operating system command to back up the database, you must explicitly copy the log file as well, as shown in the following example:

seg-source.mrk: If you are using an operating system command to back up the database, you must explicitly copy the log file as well, as shown in the following example:

target.mrk: If you are using an operating system command to back up the database, you must explicitly copy the log file as well, as shown in the following example:

trans-unit.source: If you are not using Windows, substitute the appropriate operating system command for copying a directory and all of its contents to a new location.

seg-source.mrk: If you are not using Windows, substitute the appropriate operating system command for copying a directory and all of its contents to a new location.

target.mrk: If you are not using Windows, substitute the appropriate operating system command for copying a directory and all of its contents to a new location.

trans-unit.source: Edit the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry in the <codeph>service.properties</codeph> file of the database backup so that it points to the correct location for the log. In the previous example, the log was moved to the default location for a log, so you can remove the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry entirely, or leave the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry as is and wait until the database is restored to edit the entry.

seg-source.mrk: Edit the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry in the <codeph>service.properties</codeph> file of the database backup so that it points to the correct location for the log.

In the previous example, the log was moved to the default location for a log, so you can remove the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry entirely, or leave the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry as is and wait until the database is restored to edit the entry.

target.mrk: Edit the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry in the <codeph>service.properties</codeph> file of the database backup so that it points to the correct location for the log.

In the previous example, the log was moved to the default location for a log, so you can remove the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry entirely, or leave the <codeph>logDevice</codeph> entry as is and wait until the database is restored to edit the entry.

trans-unit.source: See <xref href="cadminlog98.dita#cadminlog98"></xref> for information about the default location of the database log and about putting the log in a non-default location.

seg-source.mrk: See <xref href="cadminlog98.dita#cadminlog98"></xref> for information about the default location of the database log and about putting the log in a non-default location.

target.mrk: See <xref href="cadminlog98.dita#cadminlog98"></xref> for information about the default location of the database log and about putting the log in a non-default location.
